Sheldon Whitehouse said Paul Ryan 's plan, which slashes taxes on capital gains, would create an even larger gap between rich and poor. The Paul Ryan plan essentially relives the richest Americans from any responsibility to pay for the support of their country, he said.`` Our country should not be a country where the super rich get to play by different rules than people who are working their way up to their own American dream.'' Tight end Brent Celek agreed, when he spoke via phone yesterday with a group of reporters from his minivacation getaway in Michigan: Sometimes he's taking some big-time hits, where maybe other guys would get flagged and he's not. Hopefully, they change it. He's a quarterback, too. He's the same as everybody else. Just because he's maybe a little bit more athletic and faster and can run, he shouldn't be penalized. Expect to see more of this sort of lobbying. We're well into the stretch drive and Michael Vick , the most amazing NFL story of 2010, obviously is the key to the Eagles' postseason hopes
